publications

upcoming

Wilson, J. J., Watson, J.C.E, Oudyk, A. (forthcoming) Language, Gesture and Ecology in Modern South Arabian Languages.

journal articles and chapters

Price, H. and Wilson, J. J. (2019) Relevance Theory and Metaphor: An analysis of Tom Waits’ ‘Emmotional Weather Report’ Lanuage and Literature, 28 (1)
Wilson, J. J. and Price, H. (2018) Courtroom Data and Politeness Research: A case for Neo-Peircean semiotics in interpersonal pragmatics. The Journal of Politeness Research, 14(1): 63-95
Watson, J. C. E. and Wilson, J. J. (2017) Gesture in Modern South Arabian languages: Variation in multimodal constructions during task-based interaction. Brill’s Journal of Afroasiatic Languages and Linguistics, 9: 49–72
Merrison, A. J., Wilson, J. J., Davies, B. L., and Haugh, M. (2012) Getting Stuff Done: Comparing ‘E-mail Requests’ from Students in Higher Education in Britain and Australia. Journal of Pragmatics, 44: 1077–1098

talks, conference presentations and posters

2017 Wilson, J. J. and Watson, J. C. E. (2017) The expression of direction and Orientation in Two Modern South Arabian language. Paper presented at NACAL 45, 10th June 2017. Leiden.
Wilson, J. J. (2017) Gesture and spatial description in English and Modern South Arabian languages. Invited presentation at MPI 8th June 2017. Nijmegen.
Wilson, J. J. (2017) Semantic Gestures. Paper presented at SPiNfest, 26th May 2017. Manchester.
2015 Wilson, J. J., Price, H., and Merrison, A. J. (2015) We’re not in a club now: A semiotic analysis of the co-construction of appropriate behaviour during a courtroom interaction. Paper presented at iMean4, 9th April 2015. Warwick
2014 Wilson, J. J. (2014) To gesture or not to gesture: Investigating the compostion of multimodal communicative acts and their utility during a map task. Paper presented at University of Leeds postgraduate conference on Mulitmodality, August 2014. Leeds.
2013 Wilson, J. J. (2013) Projective Gestures: Investigating the utility of manual movements during a map task. Paper presented at University of York Postgraduate Linguistics conference, PARLAY, September 2013. York.
Wilson, J. J. and Little, Hannah, R. (2013). Emerging languages in esoteric and exoteric niches: Evidence from rural sign languages. Paper presented at Ways to Protolanguage 3, May 2013. Wroclaw.
2011 Wilson, J. J. (2011) Student researchers: What are they worth?. Paper presented as Keynote at The Student Researchers Conference: “Thinking Out Loud II”, November 2011. York.

Conference Panels

2015 Wilson, J. J., Price, H., and Merrison, A. J. (2015) Impoliteness in Court: A case study of Penelope Soto. iMean4. Warwick.

This website is a personal space for me to share my work in linguisitcs, pragmatics and gesture studies. It is also a blog for sharing partially formed ideas. Criticisms are welcome!
